headline: Trump-backed candidate J.D. Vance wins in Ohio Republican Senate primary
author: Carlos Garcia
sentences: Vance is best-known for writing "Hillbilly Elegy," a New York Times bestseller documenting the political changes among working class white people in the beleaguered region of Appalachia.
The race was largely seen as a test of the political influence Trump held within the Republican party as some elements have attempted to move forward without him.
Vance may have said some not so great things about me in the past, but he gets it now, and I have seen that in spades," said Trump in his endorsement in April.
The candidate backed by former President Donald Trump won the Republican primary for the nomination for one of the Senate seats for Ohio.
Heading into the primary election, Mandel and Vance were within the error of margin in the latest Fox News poll.
Vance received the endorsement of Trump over Mandel, even though both declared themselves pro-Trump candidates.
Mike DeWine defeated conservative primary challengers and garnered the Republican gubernatorial nomination.
DeWine faced opponents who tried to capitalize on anger over the governor's pandemic lockdown policies.
He initially mocked and rejected Trump in 2016 but later became a vocal supporter of his policies.
Vance was declared the victor over former state treasurer Josh Mandel on Tuesday.
